definitions.definition: the direction that you look towards to see the sun go down; one of the four main points of the compass

examples.text: Rain is spreading from the west.
He lives to the west of *(= further west than)* the town.
The train line facilitates travel between east and west.

definitions.definition: the western part of a country, region or city

examples.text: The west of the country is especially popular with tourists.
Around 2 000 teachers from around the West of England attended the conference.
Elsewhere in the West, wet, unsettled weather will continue until the weekend.
House prices in the west have risen significantly over the last five years.
There's been a severe earthquake in the west of the country.

definitions.definition: Europe and North America, contrasted with other parts of the world

examples.text: I was born in Japan, but I've lived in the West for some years now.

definitions.definition: the western side of the US

examples.text: the history of the American West

definitions.definition: Western Europe and North America, when contrasted with the Communist countries of Eastern Europe

wordOrigin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German west, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek hesperos, Latin vesper ‘evening’.
